thread.title: Sartorial Subtext in the Democratic Debate
thread.title_full: Sartorial Subtext in the Democratic Debate - The New York Times

author: Vanessa Friedman
title: Sartorial Subtext in the Democratic Debate
text:
Did CNN issue dress guidelines along with the actual Democratic debate guidelines on Tuesday night? A viewer could be forgiven for asking this question as the five presidential candidates filed onto the stage at the Wynn Las Vegas in essentially similar combinations of navy, dark gray and white. The effect was to make them look, startlingly enough, as if they were on the same page.
It was a message later belied, in most part, by their words, though it did reflect a debate that lacked the showboat style that has characterized the Republican get-togethers so far.
On the Runway Vanessa Friedman writes about news happening in the fashion industry, from business decisions to designer moves.
